Pre-Game Insights: The Mexico national soccer team will begin its 2024 Copa America campaign against Jamaica at NRG Stadium in Houston on Saturday, June 22, 2024.
Mexico is in Group B of the competition, which includes Jamaica, Ecuador, and Venezuela.
Mexico had disappointing friendly matches before the start of Copa America, losing 3-2 to Brazil and 4-0 to Uruguay.
Manager Jaime Lozano had to make cuts to the roster, releasing Alexis Pena, Fernando Beltran, Victor Guzman, Jordan Carrillo, and Andres Montano.
Jaime Lozano is dealing with a decision in the goalkeeper position due to an injury to Luis Angel Malagon.
The goalkeeper position is being contested by Julio Gonzalez, Raul Rangel, and Carlos Acevedo, with reports indicating Julio Gonzalez will start against Jamaica.

A possible lineup for the game against Jamaica includes Julio Gonzalez, Jorge Sanchez/Brian Garcia, Cesar Montes, Johan Vazquez, Gerardo Arteaga, Edson Alvarez, Erick Sanchez/Carlos Rodriguez, Luis Chavez, Uriel Antuna, Julian Quinones, and Santiago Gimenez.
The front three of Antuna, Gimenez, and Quinones is expected to be explosive against Jamaica.
Jamaica had controversy before the start of Copa America with Leon Bailey speaking out about mistreatment from the Jamaican Football Federation.
Leon Bailey is on the Copa America roster and is a key player for Jamaica.
Most of Jamaica’s key players, like Bailey, Michail Antonio, Demarai Gray, Bobby Decordova-Reid, and Ethan Pinnock, play or have played in England.
Jamaica won third place at the last Nations League competition and are currently playing World Cup qualifiers, coming off wins against the Dominican Republic and Dominica.
Mexico’s opening match against Jamaica is considered a must-win contest for first-place aspirations in Group B.
